result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel J Blank

records.addlTxt: Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights

9:12 AM 2021CF000087, 2021CF000094, 2022CF000012, 2022CF000047, 2022CF000112, 2022CF000113 - Defendant Daniel J Blank in court, in custody.  Attorney Andrew J. Burdick in court for Daniel J Blank.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Forehand states the joint agreement to enter pleas in 2021CF000087; count 2, 2021CF000094; count 1, 2, 5, 2022CF000047; count 2, 2022CF000112; count 2, and 2022CF000113; count 1. All other counts and cases will be DRI.

Court review the plea questionnaire. Court goes over the maximum penalties. Court finds a factual basis. DB enters a plea of NC. Court finds the defendant guilty. Attorney Forehand heard and speaks about her conversations with the victim. Attorney Burdick heard. DB heard.

2021CF000087; count 2, 2021CF000094; count 1 and 2, 2022CF000047; count 2:

Court withholds sentence and orders probation for 2 years.

Conditions:
No contact with the victim.
Participate and successfully complete domestic abuse counseling.

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any treatment or programming ordered by the agent.
Obey all rules and regulations of the department.

Pay costs, fees, and any surcharges on  22CF113 and 21CF94

Credit in the event of revocation: 5 days credit   (Attorney Burdick will petition the court if there is more credit then 5 days.)
Submit DNA sample at the Richland County Sheriff's Department.
Sign up for probation today


2021CF000094; Count 5
Court orders: 30 days in the Richland County Jail or any jail in Wisconsin that will accept him.
Huber granted.

2022CF000112; Count 2
Court orders: 9 months in the Richland County Jail or any jail in Wisconsin that will accept him; consecutive to 22CF94
Huber granted.
Credit of 50 days.

2022CF000113
Court orders: 60 days in the Richland County Jail or any jail in Wisconsin that will accept him; consecutive to 22CF94 and 22CF112
Huber granted.

2022CF000012 - DRI

All other counts DRI.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
and Request for Return of Action to Substituted Judge
Granting Request for Return of Action to Substituted Judge
Status conference on October 17, 2022 at 10:45 am.

11:15 AM Defendant Daniel J Blank appeared by video.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Andrew J. Burdick appeared by video for Daniel J Blank. Atty. Burdick states that the Def has Iowa County matters as well and Defense is seeking private investigation in his matters, notes offer has been received by the state, and requests additional status. Court sets another status to allow Defense' investigator change to perform their work. Court sets 10/17 at 10:45 a.m. Atty. Forehand notes that is during the Richland County trial week so it is possible that date will conflict. Court advises the State to update the Court if that happens.

1:03 PM Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Andrew J. Burdick appeared by video for Daniel J Blank. Defendant Daniel J Blank appeared by phone. 22CF12 and 22CF47 on the calendar for prelim today; other cases on for status. Defense has indicated Def wishes to waive right to prelim. Court's colloquy with Def. Waiver accepted. Probable cause found. Bindover ordered. State filing information same as complaints. NG pleas entered. Status requested and set. 8/1 at 11:15.
Status conference scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Status conference on August 1, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:44 AM 2021CF000087, 2021CF000094, 2022CF000012- Defendant Daniel J Blank appeared by video.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. State has spoken with Attorney Burdick about a new matter that was going to be filed today. Court speaks about court history. Attorney Burdick appears by video. Court calls  2022CF000047. Attorney Burdick has review the charges but his client doesn't have a copy of the complaint. Attorney Burdick waives the formal reading. Max penalties stated. Attorney Burdick asks for a preliminary hearing in 22CF12 and 22CF47. 

State asks for a $2,000 cash bond with a no contact with the victim in 22CF47. Attorney Burdick asks for a signature bond. Court orders $2,000 signature bond with a no contact with the victim.

Attorney Burdick waives the time limits to a  preliminary hearing. Court sets preliminary hearing date in 22CF12 and 22CF47. Status Scheduled in 21CF94 and 21CF87. Attorney Burdick will file a substitution request in 22CF47.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 25, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 31, 2022 at 10:45 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: for Substitution of Judge

01:06 PM Attorney Andrew J. Burdick appeared by phone means for Defendant Daniel J Blank. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Daniel J Blank not in court. Attorney Forehand asks for a warrant. Attorney Burdick objects to the warrant and asks for this to be adjourn so he can give him a call. 01:25 Same appearances with DB appearing by phone. Attorney Burdick had reviewed the complaint. Max penalties stated. Attorney Burdick asks for a preliminary hearing to be scheduled in a couple weeks. Attorney Burdick waives the time limits to a preliminary hearing. DB concurs. Court asks that Attorney Burdick do a substitution on this case so things will be filled with Judge Rood along with his other cases.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
until March 9, 2022

01:17 PM Attorney Andrew J. Burdick appeared by video means for Defendant Daniel J Blank. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Daniel J Blank not in court. Attorney Burdick tried to contact the defendant with no luck. CC Angel ask about substitution. Attorney Burdick needs to speak about that. Victim speaks and would like a warrant issued. Attorney Burdick comments. Attorney Forehand asks for a warrant but stay it to March 9th at 1 PM. So ordered. Victim speaks about bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Forehand appears for the State. DB appears by video in the RCSD Jail.
Court asks about the defendant getting an attorney.  DB comments.

Court reset to 3:45 PM today. (01/31/22)

DB states that he thought he had a signature bond. Attorney Forehand states that was only while in the Richland Hospital, now he is back to a cash bond.

03:54 PM - Same parties. 
Attorney Forehand explains why she is request cash for this defendant.
DB comment about health and asks for a reduced bond.
Court asks Attorney Forehand if she is aware of medical conditions.
Court asks the defendant if he can post any amount of money.
Court reduces bond to $500 cash, same conditions.
Next hearing 03/03/22 at 1 PM

The defendants  $2000 cash bond shall revert to a $2000 signature with the same conditions as long as he is a patient in the Richland Medical Center/Richland Hospital and the defendant gives consent to the Richland County Medical Center/Hospital to provide the Richland County Sheriffs Department with any and all medical information and discharge status beginning on 1/28/22 at 12AM and until further order of the court.
No contact with victim

By Zoom at 1:01 p.m. Appearances: ADA Forehand for the State, Def from the jail, Atty. McDougal for the defense for this hearing (notes that Atty. Blake Duren reps Def in another matter and will be appointed in this as well). State requests 2k cash bond plus no contact with the victim, to be named in a sealed key. Atty. McDougal addresses the Court. Court sets 2k cash - no contact with victim. 1/31/22 at 1 p.m. for the initial.
